newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila interbank call loan rates ease.
newsitem.headline: Manila interbank call loan rates ease.

text.p: Philippine interbank call loan rates eased on Thursday to an average of 11.71875 percent from 11.96875 as most banks have now adjusted their reserve positions, traders said.
"Banks are now more comfortable" as the end of the reserve week nears, said a dealer.
Rates ranged from 12.25 percent to 10.5625. Volume thinned to 26.125 billion pesos from 28.215 billion.
Early in the week, banks had been experiencing a temporary tightness since most banks had locked in their money in fixed income securities ahead of an anticipated further decline in interest rates.
The maturity of special series Treasury bills on Wednesday plus the pesos released by the Central Bank from its dollar purchases gave more liquidity to banks, a dealer said.
